org.agreement_technologies.common.map_heuristic

Interface HPlan

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Plan
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPlan
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    POPIncrementalPlan

    public interface HPlan
extends Plan
    HPlan interface provides the necessary methods in a plan to compute heuristic values.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.agreement_technologies.common.map_planner.Plan

        CoDMAP_CENTRALIZED, CoDMAP_DISTRIBUTED, INITIAL, REGULAR, UNASSIGNED

    • Method Detail

      • linearization

        int[] linearization()
        Gets the steps of the plan sorted in a topological order.
        Returns:
        Array of step indexes
        Since:
        1.0

      • computeMultiState

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> computeMultiState(int[] totalOrder,
                                                                                          PlannerFactory pf)
        Computes the resulting frontier state after the plan execution. This method is used in distributed problems.
        Parameters:
        totalOrder - Indexes of the plan steps sorted in a topological order
        pf - Planner factory
        Returns:
        Frontier multi-state. It is a multi-state as this structure allows to store several values for each variable
        Since:
        1.0

      • computeState

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> computeState(int[] totalOrder,
                                                                PlannerFactory pf)
        Computes the resulting frontier state after the plan execution. This method is used in centralized problems.
        Parameters:
        totalOrder - Indexes of the plan steps sorted in a topological order
        pf - Planner factory
        Returns:
        Frontier state. In this structure only one value is stored for each variable
        Since:
        1.0

      • computeCodeState

        int[] computeCodeState(int[] totalOrder,
                     int numVars)
        Computes the resulting frontier state after the plan execution. This method is used in centralized problems, and works with indexes instead of variables and values names.
        Parameters:
        totalOrder - Indexes of the plan steps sorted in a topological order
        numVars - Number of (non-numeric) variables in the state
        Returns:
        State. For each variable, this array stores the index of its value
        Since:
        1.0

      • lastAddedStep

        Step lastAddedStep()
        Gets the last step added to the plan.
        Returns:
        Last added step
        Since:
        1.0
